title: SB 1.17.34 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 14-03-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञानति मिरान्धस्य ज्ञानान्जनिषलाकया चक्षुरुन्मीलितं येनातस्मै श्री गुरवे नमः
नमाओम विष्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्री मते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्निति नामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गवरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेशा शुन्यवादी पाश्चात्यदेशतारिने
जय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभू नित्यानन्दा श्री अद्वैत गणाधरा श्रीवासादी गवरभक्त वृन्दा
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Deviim Sarasvatim Vyasam Tato Jayam Udhirayet
In this session we will be discussing from the thirty-fourth verse of the seventeenth chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Yasmin Harir Bhagavan Igyamana Igyatma Murtir Yajatam Shamtanoti
Kaman Amoghan Sthira Jangamanam Antar Bahirvayur Ivaisha Atma
The meaning of this verse is, in all sacrificial ceremonies, although sometimes a demigod is worshipped,
the Supreme Lord, Personality of Godhead, is worshipped because He is the Supersoul of everyone and exists both inside and outside like the air.
Thus it is He only who awards all welfare to the worshipper.
This is a very important verse because a certain secret is revealed about the nature of God.
Because people sometimes get confused, especially in the Hindu religion as they call it.
The Vedas don't describe any...
where that our religious system is called a Hindu religious system.
But it has come into practice to label our system as the Hindu religious system.
Basically the followers of the Vedas, the Vedic scriptures, among them there are some
who worship God.
They worship God.
They worship God as one Supreme person.
And like the Vaishnavas.
And there are impersonalists who worship God as the Supreme Brahman, impersonal Brahman.
They don't exactly describe what is God or who is God.
They basically say God is without form, without any qualities, without any attributes,
Nirmisesha, Nirvikara, Nirmikalpa, like that.
They go on describing in a negative way and ultimately they don't say what is God.
And then there are some people who worship a representation of God, which is the Supreme
Lord, the Supreme Beholder.
And there are some who worship God as the Supreme God.
a material representation in the scriptures they are called devatas or as Prabhupada says demigods
demigods means almost like God but not equal to God so demigods of worship like Indra Chandra
varuna or Ganesha or Shiva or Durga in so many forms Durga is worshipped in so many forms Shiva is
worshipped in so many forms the other devatas of worshiped and represented by sometimes even the
elements like fire fire
fire or even bodies of water, worshipping the river, or worshipping a tree, or worshipping the ocean, worshipping fire, worshipping the sun, worshipping the moon, etc.
So, all these different types of worship are in a nutshell explained here by Srila Prabhupada.
So, Srila Prabhupada says in the purport,
It is even sometimes seen that demigods like Indra and Chandra worshipped and offered sacrificial awards.
In the scriptures, there is a recommendation that somebody may worship a particular devata for a particular purpose.
For a particular material benefit.
And the sacrifices offered in the name of such devata.
Indraya Swaha or Agnaya Swaha
Like that, different demigods. There are so many demigods.
Actually, according to our authentic Vedic scriptures, there are 33 crore devatas.
Though most people do not worship or do not know about 33 crore devatas.
But some prominent ones are worshipped.
Especially nowadays, you can even see temples dedicated for worship of deities of Shiva, Durga, Ganesha, Kartikeya.
And, of course, the Vaishnavas worship Krishna, Rama.
Narsimha, Varaha, Vamana.
So many different temples for these deities.
And even sacrifices, fire sacrifices for pleasing Narsimha, Narsimha Homa.
Or for pleasing Krishna as Krishna Yagna.
Or Ramathar Ka Homa.
Like that.
So many different types of worship.
Of different forms of the Supreme Lord.
Krishna, Rama, Narsimha, Varaha.
Authorized.
And then the forms of the demigods.
Like Indra, Chandra, Varuna, Vayu.
So Srila Prabhupada says,
Yet the rewards of all such sacrifices are awarded to the worshipper by the Supreme Lord only.
If somebody follows the Vedic directions
and worships either a deity of Ganesha
or performs a sacrifice for pleasing Ganesha.
Gana Homa, they say.
Ganapati Homa.
In any case,
the ultimate reward is given only by the Supreme Lord Krishna.
How is that?
Because it is the Supreme Lord who is situated in the heart of everyone,
including the Devatas.
And he is everywhere present in the heart of everyone.
He has entered into everything.
Vishnu means one who enters into everything.
After his creation takes place.
The Supreme Lord expands as Paramatma.
And enters into the heart of all living entities.
And even enters into every atom.
Material atom.
Andantarastha paramanu chayantarastham.
He enters the created universe.
He enters every planet.
He enters the heart of every created being.
He enters into every material atom.
Paramanu.
Anda means the universal shell.
Vishwatma.
So, like that,
the Supreme Lord as Paramatma is present in everyone's heart.
Everywhere.
Even the Devata's heart.
Indra, Chandra, Varuna, Vayu.
Everyone's heart.
The Supreme Lord is present as Paramatma.
And it is this Lord who is present in the heart of everyone.
Who is also present as the maintainer Vishnu.
Who is also present as Maha Vishnu.
The origin of this creation itself.
The creator, maintainer and destroyer of all the universes.
And present in the spiritual world
as Narayana.
As Krishna.
So, that Supreme Lord is present in everyone's heart.
Is present everywhere.
Is in the spiritual world.
Is in the material world.
So, he actually is the only one who can avoid the results of all such bona fide sacrifices.
He is the one who maintains everyone.
He is the one who accepts the sacrifices.
If it is offered according to the Vedic directions.
So, when somebody offers a sacrifice to Indra.
It is through Indra that they are actually offering to the Supreme Lord.
Through Indra.
So, in the Bhagavad Gita this is clarified.
Bhagavad Gita is the final scripture which clarifies all such apparent confusions or contradictions in the directions given in the original Vedas.
Bhagavad Gita clarifies this.
Bhagavad Gita it is said.
That whatever a man may sacrifice to other gods.
Gods here mean demigods.
O son of Kunti is really meant for me alone.
Me, Krishna is speaking.
It is meant for Krishna only.
But it is offered without true understanding.
Yajante avidhi purvakam.
They are not following the proper.
Method of offering the sacrifice.
Because sacrifice means to ultimately please the Yajneshwara.
The Supreme Lord of all sacrifices.
That is the Supreme Lord Vishnu.
Vishnu.
Yajna vai Vishnu.
Yajna means Vishnu.
So, there is only one Supreme Lord.
He is one without a second.
Ekameva advitiya.
This is the statement of the Vedas.
One only.
Supreme Lord is one only.
There is no other God other than the Supreme Lord himself.
Thus the Supreme Lord is eternally transcendental to the material creation.
This is a very important point.
There is this material creation consisting of different planets, different personalities.
And different powers.
Different heads of the
rulers.
Head of the particular
living entities in a particular planet.
The chief
of the planet.
Planetary systems.
Indra is the king of heaven.
And then there is Indraloka.
Then there is
Chandra, the moon god.
The predominant in deity of the moon planet.
The sun god, Suryadeva.
Predominant in deity of the sun planet.
Like that there are so many planets.
So many personalities.
But Krishna is above this material creation.
And he is the lord of everyone.
He is seated in everyone's heart.
Suryadeva's heart.
Chandra Deva's heart.
Ganesha's heart.
And Shiva's heart.
Parvati or Durga Devi's heart.
He is seated in heart of everyone.
He is the lord of everyone.
He is the lord of everyone.
He is above everybody.
So Prabhupada says
the demigods are indirect qualitative representation of supreme lord.
So a learned devotee or a learned scholar in the Vedas
knows who is who.
He knows what is the position of the devatas.
And what is the position of supreme lord Krishna.
So the really learned people they worship only Krishna.
But others may worship Indra, Chandra, Varuna, etc.
as a representative of Krishna.
Accepting on behalf of Krishna.
And passing on to Krishna the supreme lord.
So this is the correct understanding.
About the recommendations for worship of Indra, Chandra, Ganesha, Shiva, etc.
I will stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
